memberdef.definition: typedef int(* ssh_thread_callback) (void **lock)
memberdef.name: ssh_thread_callback

memberdef.definition: typedef unsigned long(* ssh_thread_id_callback) (void)
memberdef.name: ssh_thread_id_callback

memberdef.definition: LIBSSH_API int ssh_threads_set_callbacks
memberdef.name: ssh_threads_set_callbacks

briefdescription.para: Set the thread callbacks structure.

detaileddescription.para: This is necessary if your program is using libssh in a multithreaded fashion. This function must be called first, outside of any threading context (in your main() function for instance), before you call ssh_init().

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a ssh_threads_callbacks_struct structure, which contains the different callbacks to be set.

simplesect.para: Always returns SSH_OK.
SSH_THREADS_PTHREAD

xrefdescription.para: libgcrypt 1.6 and bigger backend does not support custom callback. Using anything else than pthreads here will fail.

memberdef.definition: LIBSSH_API struct ssh_threads_callbacks_struct* ssh_threads_get_default
memberdef.name: ssh_threads_get_default

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the appropriate callbacks structure for the environment, to be used with ssh_threads_set_callbacks.

simplesect.para: A pointer to a ssh_threads_callbacks_struct to be used with ssh_threads_set_callbacks.

memberdef.definition: LIBSSH_API struct ssh_threads_callbacks_struct* ssh_threads_get_pthread
memberdef.name: ssh_threads_get_pthread

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer on the pthread threads callbacks, to be used with ssh_threads_set_callbacks.

memberdef.definition: LIBSSH_API struct ssh_threads_callbacks_struct* ssh_threads_get_noop
memberdef.name: ssh_threads_get_noop

briefdescription.para: Get the noop threads callbacks structure.

detaileddescription.para: This can be used with ssh_threads_set_callbacks. These callbacks do nothing and are being used by default.

simplesect.para: Always returns a valid pointer to the noop callbacks structure.

memberdef.definition: LIBSSH_API int ssh_set_log_callback
memberdef.name: ssh_set_log_callback

briefdescription.para: Set the logging callback function.

parameterdescription.para: The callback to set.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, < 0 on errror.

memberdef.definition: LIBSSH_API ssh_logging_callback ssh_get_log_callback
memberdef.name: ssh_get_log_callback

briefdescription.para: Get the pointer to the logging callback function.

simplesect.para: The pointer the the callback or NULL if none set.

briefdescription.para: Initializes an ssh_callbacks_struct A call to this macro is mandatory when you have set a new ssh_callback_struct structure. Its goal is to maintain the binary compatibility with future versions of libssh as the structure evolves with time.

memberdef.name: ssh_callbacks_execute_list
memberdef.initializer: do { \ struct ssh_iterator *i = ssh_list_get_iterator(list); \ cbtype cb; \ while (i != NULL){ \ cb = ssh_iterator_value(cbtype, i); \ if (ssh_callbacks_exists(cb, c)) \ cb-> c (__VA_ARGS__, cb->userdata); \ i = i->next; \ } \ } while(0)

memberdef.name: ssh_callbacks_iterate
memberdef.initializer: do { \ struct ssh_iterator *_cb_i = ssh_list_get_iterator(_cb_list); \ _cb_type _cb; \ for (; _cb_i != NULL; _cb_i = _cb_i->next) { \ _cb = ssh_iterator_value(_cb_type, _cb_i); \ if (ssh_callbacks_exists(_cb, _cb_name))

detaileddescription.para: return values for a ssh_packet_callback Packet was used and should not be parsed by another callback
Packet was not used and should be passed to any other callback available

memberdef.name: SSH_PACKET_CALLBACK
memberdef.initializer: int name (ssh_session session, uint8_t type, ssh_buffer packet, void *user)

briefdescription.para: This macro declares a packet callback handler.

the actual message

Percentage of connection status, going from 0.0 to 1.0 once connection is done.
Userdata to be passed to the callback function.

memberdef.definition: typedef ssh_channel(* ssh_channel_open_request_x11_callback) (ssh_session session, const char *originator_address, int originator_port, void *userdata)
memberdef.argsstring: )(ssh_session session, const char *originator_address, int originator_port, void *userdata)
memberdef.name: ssh_channel_open_request_x11_callback

briefdescription.para: Handles an SSH new channel open X11 request. This happens when the server sends back an X11 connection attempt. This is a client-side API.

parameterdescription.para: current session handler
Userdata to be passed to the callback function.

simplesect.para: a valid ssh_channel handle if the request is to be allowed
NULL if the request should not be allowed
The channel pointer returned by this callback must be closed by the application.

memberdef.definition: typedef ssh_channel(* ssh_channel_open_request_auth_agent_callback) (ssh_session session, void *userdata)
memberdef.name: ssh_channel_open_request_auth_agent_callback

briefdescription.para: Handles an SSH new channel open "auth-agent" request. This happens when the server sends back an "auth-agent" connection attempt. This is a client-side API.

parameterdescription.para: current session handler
Userdata to be passed to the callback function.

simplesect.para: a valid ssh_channel handle if the request is to be allowed
NULL if the request should not be allowed
The channel pointer returned by this callback must be closed by the application.

memberdef.definition: typedef struct ssh_callbacks_struct* ssh_callbacks
memberdef.name: ssh_callbacks

memberdef.definition: typedef int(* ssh_auth_password_callback) (ssh_session session, const char *user, const char *password, void *userdata)
memberdef.argsstring: )(ssh_session session, const char *user, const char *password, void *userdata)
memberdef.name: ssh_auth_password_callback

briefdescription.para: SSH authentication callback.

detaileddescription.para:
These are callbacks used specifically in SSH servers.
session
Current session handler
user
User that wants to authenticate
password
Password used for authentication
userdata
Userdata to be passed to the callback function.
SSH_AUTH_SUCCESS Authentication is accepted.
SSH_AUTH_PARTIAL Partial authentication, more authentication means are needed.
SSH_AUTH_DENIED Authentication failed.

memberdef.definition: typedef int(* ssh_auth_none_callback) (ssh_session session, const char *user, void *userdata)
memberdef.name: ssh_auth_none_callback

briefdescription.para: SSH authentication callback. Tries to authenticates user with the "none" method which is anonymous or passwordless.

parameterdescription.para: Current session handler
User that wants to authenticate
Userdata to be passed to the callback function.

simplesect.para: SSH_AUTH_SUCCESS Authentication is accepted.
SSH_AUTH_PARTIAL Partial authentication, more authentication means are needed.
SSH_AUTH_DENIED Authentication failed.

memberdef.definition: typedef int(* ssh_auth_gssapi_mic_callback) (ssh_session session, const char *user, const char *principal, void *userdata)
memberdef.argsstring: )(ssh_session session, const char *user, const char *principal, void *userdata)
memberdef.name: ssh_auth_gssapi_mic_callback

briefdescription.para: SSH authentication callback. Tries to authenticates user with the "gssapi-with-mic" method.

parameterdescription.para: Current session handler
Username of the user (can be spoofed)
Authenticated principal of the user, including realm.
Userdata to be passed to the callback function.

simplesect.para: SSH_AUTH_SUCCESS Authentication is accepted.
SSH_AUTH_PARTIAL Partial authentication, more authentication means are needed.
SSH_AUTH_DENIED Authentication failed.
Implementations should verify that parameter user matches in some way the principal. user and principal can be different. Only the latter is guaranteed to be safe.

memberdef.definition: typedef int(* ssh_auth_pubkey_callback) (ssh_session session, const char *user, struct ssh_key_struct *pubkey, char signature_state, void *userdata)
memberdef.argsstring: )(ssh_session session, const char *user, struct ssh_key_struct *pubkey, char signature_state, void *userdata)
memberdef.name: ssh_auth_pubkey_callback

briefdescription.para: SSH authentication callback.

parameterdescription.para: Current session handler
User that wants to authenticate
public key used for authentication
SSH_PUBLICKEY_STATE_NONE if the key is not signed (simple public key probe), SSH_PUBLICKEY_STATE_VALID if the signature is valid. Others values should be replied with a SSH_AUTH_DENIED.
Userdata to be passed to the callback function.

simplesect.para: SSH_AUTH_SUCCESS Authentication is accepted.
SSH_AUTH_PARTIAL Partial authentication, more authentication means are needed.
SSH_AUTH_DENIED Authentication failed.

memberdef.definition: typedef int(* ssh_service_request_callback) (ssh_session session, const char *service, void *userdata)
memberdef.name: ssh_service_request_callback

briefdescription.para: Handles an SSH service request.

parameterdescription.para: current session handler
name of the service (e.g. "ssh-userauth") requested
Userdata to be passed to the callback function.

simplesect.para: 0 if the request is to be allowed
-1 if the request should not be allowed

Userdata to be passed to the callback function.

NULL if the request should not be allowed
The channel pointer returned by this callback must be closed by the application.

memberdef.definition: typedef int(* ssh_packet_callback) (ssh_session session, uint8_t type, ssh_buffer packet, void *user)
memberdef.argsstring: )(ssh_session session, uint8_t type, ssh_buffer packet, void *user)
memberdef.name: ssh_packet_callback

briefdescription.para: Prototype for a packet callback, to be called when a new packet arrives.

parameterdescription.para: The current session of the packet
packet type (see ssh2.h)
buffer containing the packet, excluding size, type and padding fields
user argument to the callback and are called each time a packet shows up

simplesect.para: SSH_PACKET_USED Packet was parsed and used
SSH_PACKET_NOT_USED Packet was not used or understood, processing must continue

memberdef.definition: typedef struct ssh_packet_callbacks_struct* ssh_packet_callbacks
memberdef.name: ssh_packet_callbacks

memberdef.definition: typedef int(* ssh_channel_data_callback) (ssh_session session, ssh_channel channel, void *data, uint32_t len, int is_stderr, void *userdata)
memberdef.argsstring: )(ssh_session session, ssh_channel channel, void *data, uint32_t len, int is_stderr, void *userdata)
memberdef.name: ssh_channel_data_callback

briefdescription.para: SSH channel data callback. Called when data is available on a channel.

parameterdescription.para: Current session handler
the actual channel
the data that has been read on the channel
the length of the data
is 0 for stdout or 1 for stderr
Userdata to be passed to the callback function.

simplesect.para: number of bytes processed by the callee. The remaining bytes will be sent in the next callback message, when more data is available.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* ssh_channel_eof_callback) (ssh_session session, ssh_channel channel, void *userdata)
memberdef.name: ssh_channel_eof_callback

briefdescription.para: SSH channel eof callback. Called when a channel receives EOF.

parameterdescription.para: Current session handler
the actual channel
Userdata to be passed to the callback function.

memberdef.name: ssh_channel_close_callback

briefdescription.para: SSH channel close callback. Called when a channel is closed by remote peer.

parameterdescription.para: Current session handler
the actual channel
Userdata to be passed to the callback function.

the actual channel
the signal name (without the SIG prefix)

memberdef.argsstring: )(ssh_session session, ssh_channel channel, const char *signal, int core, const char *errmsg, const char *lang, void *userdata)
memberdef.name: ssh_channel_exit_signal_callback

briefdescription.para: SSH channel exit signal callback. Called when a channel has received an exit signal.

parameterdescription.para: Current session handler
the actual channel
the signal name (without the SIG prefix)
a boolean telling wether a core has been dumped or not
the description of the exception
the language of the description (format: RFC 3066)
Userdata to be passed to the callback function.

memberdef.definition: typedef int(* ssh_channel_pty_request_callback) (ssh_session session, ssh_channel channel, const char *term, int width, int height, int pxwidth, int pwheight, void *userdata)

The type of terminal emulation
width of the terminal, in characters
height of the terminal, in characters
width of the terminal, in pixels
height of the terminal, in pixels

-1 if the request is denied

Userdata to be passed to the callback function.

Userdata to be passed to the callback function.

briefdescription.para: SSH channel write will not block (flow control).

parameterdescription.para: the channel
size of the remote window in bytes. Writing as much data will not block.
Userdata to be passed to the callback function.

simplesect.para: 0 default return value (other return codes may be added in future).

memberdef.definition: typedef struct ssh_channel_callbacks_struct* ssh_channel_callbacks
memberdef.name: ssh_channel_callbacks

memberdef.definition: LIBSSH_API int ssh_set_server_callbacks
memberdef.name: ssh_set_server_callbacks

briefdescription.para: Set the session server callback functions.

detaileddescription.para: This functions sets the callback structure to use your own callback functions for user authentication, new channels and requests.
Note, that the structure is not copied to the session structure so it needs to be valid for the whole session lifetime.

parameterdescription.para: The session to set the callback structure.
The callback structure itself.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR on error.

memberdef.definition: LIBSSH_API int ssh_set_callbacks
memberdef.name: ssh_set_callbacks

briefdescription.para: Set the session callback functions.

detaileddescription.para: This functions sets the callback structure to use your own callback functions for auth, logging and status.
Note, that the callback structure is not copied into the session so it needs to be valid for the whole session lifetime.

parameterdescription.para: The session to set the callback structure.
The callback structure itself.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR on error.

memberdef.definition: LIBSSH_API int ssh_set_channel_callbacks
memberdef.name: ssh_set_channel_callbacks

briefdescription.para: Set the channel callback functions.

detaileddescription.para: This functions sets the callback structure to use your own callback functions for channel data and exceptions.
Note, that the structure is not copied to the channel structure so it needs to be valid as for the whole life of the channel or until it is removed with ssh_remove_channel_callbacks().

parameterdescription.para: The channel to set the callback structure.
The callback structure itself.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR on error.
this function will not replace existing callbacks but set the new one atop of them.

memberdef.definition: LIBSSH_API int ssh_add_channel_callbacks
memberdef.name: ssh_add_channel_callbacks

briefdescription.para: Add channel callback functions.

detaileddescription.para: This function will add channel callback functions to the channel callback list. Callbacks missing from a callback structure will be probed in the next on the list.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to set the callback structure.
The callback structure itself.

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR on error.

memberdef.definition: LIBSSH_API int ssh_remove_channel_callbacks
memberdef.name: ssh_remove_channel_callbacks

briefdescription.para: Remove a channel callback.

detaileddescription.para: The channel has been added with ssh_add_channel_callbacks or ssh_set_channel_callbacks in this case.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to remove the callback structure from.
The callback structure to remove

simplesect.para: SSH_OK on success, SSH_ERROR on error.
